intro: Monopsis zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's monopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Monopsis zeyheri is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
